name: foremast
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the mast (= a tall pole that supports a sail) that is nearest the front of a ship: He was ordered up the 120ft foremast to set the sails. The ship was hit by a shell, bringing the foremast down.
More examplesFewer examplesA ship came into view, with a black flag black flying from her foremast.The crew prepared to lift the ship's 100ft foremast back into place.The deck guns began firing and blew off the foremast.
